segments.text: My eyes keep returning to that boy on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool itself looks so precarious, its legs splayed out at odd angles.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's tilted backward, and I can almost see it rocking with every tiny movement he makes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretched quite far to reach the cookie jar, pulling his center of gravity off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me genuinely fearful that he's going to fall at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl below seems oblivious to the danger, only focused on the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A bad fall could really hurt him, perhaps even break something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm anxious just watching him teeter like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why doesn't he notice how unstable his perch is?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation fills me with a sense of dread.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of him falling onto that hard kitchen floor is unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I really wish someone would stabilize that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR
